References Initially Created in the Application

When a folder or item is added to StarTeam, an initial reference is created. For example, if a folder is added to a new project, this reference has several parts, including the project name, the view path, the folder path, and the tip revision number. As changes are made to the folder properties, the revision number may change from 1.0 to 1.1 and later 1.2. However, this folder still has only one reference.

If a reference view is created, the view hierarchy for the project would contain two views, but the folder would continue to have only one reference. The reason for this is that a reference view contains a subset of the folders in its parent view, but the folders are the same folders as those in the parent view and cannot branch.

Additional references will not appear in the Folder References dialog until the folder is shared manually by a user or shared automatically when a branching child view is created.

A folder or item reference can be thought of as a reference count. It indicates how many copies of the object exist or can exist if the object branches in each of its new locations.
